body:
Hi @xiaobaiskill eth_subscribe is well supported on xdai, our clients do use it.

Trying your request on my node, gives:
< {"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32602,"message":"Invalid params","data":"Incorrect parameters count, expected: 2, actual: 0"},"id":1}

which is expected as it lacks needed parameters.

The 'not supported' message means that our rpc method resolve system didn't manage to found this method registered at all.  
It would be '{methodName} found but the containing module is disabled, consider adding module to JsonRpcConfig.EnabledModules' if it was not enabled and '{methodName} found but disabled for {rpcEndpoint}' if you called it through http instead of web sockets...

This leads to conclusion that either there is something corrupted with your binaries or maybe there is some startup error during method registration?

Are you using docker or binaries? Can you check startup logs?

i used binaries,
this is my xdai_archive.conf
```
{
  "Init": {
    "WebSocketsEnabled": true,
    "StoreReceipts" : true,
    "IsMining": false,
    "ChainSpecPath": "chainspec/xdai.json",
    "GenesisHash": "0x4f1dd23188aab3a76b463e4af801b52b1248ef073c648cbdc4c9333d3da79756",
    "BaseDbPath": "nethermind_db/xdai_archive",
    "LogFileName": "xdai_archive.logs.txt",
    "MemoryHint": 1024000000
  },
  "Network": {
    "DiscoveryPort": 30303,
    "P2PPort": 30303
  },
    "TxPool": {
      "Size": 1024
    },
  "JsonRpc": {
    "Enabled": true,
    "Timeout": 20000,
    "Host": "0.0.0.0",
    "Port": 8545,
    "WebSocketsPort": 8546
  },
  "Db": {
    "CacheIndexAndFilterBlocks": false
  },
  "Sync": {
    "FastSync": false,
    "UseGethLimitsInFastBlocks" : false
  },
  "EthStats": {
    "Enabled": false,
    "Server": "ws://0.0.0.0:3000/api",
    "Name": "Nethermind xDai",
    "Secret": "secret",
    "Contact": "hello@nethermind.io"
  },
  "Metrics": {
    "NodeName": "xDai Archive",
    "Enabled": false,
    "PushGatewayUrl": "http://0.0.0.0:9091/metrics",
    "IntervalSeconds": 5
  },
  "Aura":
  {
    "ForceSealing": true
  },
  "Bloom":
  {
    "IndexLevelBucketSizes" : [16, 16, 16]
  }
}
```

```
May 28 08:39:04 192-168-8-32 Nethermind.Runner[1505201]: 2021-05-28 08:39:04.0368|Executing JSON RPC call eth_blockNumber with params []
```

i used eth_blockNumber ,this is ok ,
```
> {"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_blockNumber","params":[],"id":1}
< {"jsonrpc":"2.0","result":"0xf5c2ea","id":1}
```

but eth_subscribe is not ok, Is there a problem with my config?
@xiaobaiskill when you restart the node are there any errors? Also what version are you using?

version:
```
Nethermind/v1.10.24-0-5a8edd8aa-20210529/X64-Linux/5.0.3
```

systemd:
```
[Unit]
Description=Nethermind Ethereum Daemon
After=network.target

[Service]
User=root
WorkingDirectory=/root/svc/nethermind
ExecStart=/root/svc/nethermind/Nethermind.Runner --config xdai_archive
Restart=on-failure
LimitNOFILE=1000000

[Install]
WantedBy=default.target
```

v1.10.24 is already 3 months old, can you check on one of newest versions? Also its not xdai-Berlin compatible so even if it works for you it might fork any block.

Log you supplied is already after initial startup.

i use version 1.10.27 ,but it still doesn't support eth_ subscribe.
i found that xdai can use eth_subscribe mothod, but xdai_archive does not support this mothod.

We added support for eth_subscribe in version 1.10.27, in version 1.10.24 subscription has not been implemented yet.
On this log from 1.10.24 you can see there is no Subscribe on the list of RPC modules - it was added later.
In 1.10.34 there was a fix for an issue connected with eth_subscribe so using version lower than 1.10.34 is definitely not recommended. I recommend trying newest version (1.10.72 at this moment) and if it doesn't help, we will investigate further.

More information about using eth_subscribe on Nethermind:
https://docs.nethermind.io/nethermind/ethereum-client/json-rpc/subscribe
Closing, please update to newer version
